      • list

        public static java.lang.String[] list(java.lang.String directory)
                               throws BaseException
        Returns a raw directory listing with no additional processing: useful for when performance takes priority over ease of use; for example, when the directory contains hundreds of thousands or more files.
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory to list.
        Returns:
        The list of item names in the given directory.
        Throws:
        BaseException - If the directory string is unparseable or the directory does not exist.

      • list

      • purge

        public static long purge(java.io.File directory,
                         javax.xml.datatype.Duration duration,
                         boolean recurse)
                  throws BaseException
        Deletes all files in the given directory, and child directories if recurse is true, older than the given duration.
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory to be purged.
        duration - The age files must be before they are deleted.
        recurse - If true, then child files and directories will also be recursively purged.
        Returns:
        The number of files deleted.
        Throws:
        BaseException - If the directory does not exist.

      • purge

        public static long purge(java.io.File directory,
                         java.util.Calendar olderThan,
                         boolean recurse)
                  throws BaseException
        Deletes all files in the given directory, and child directories if recurse is true, older than the given duration.
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory to be purged.
        olderThan - Only files modified prior to this datetime will be deleted.
        recurse - If true, then child files and directories will also be recursively purged.
        Returns:
        The number of files deleted.
        Throws:
        BaseException - If the directory does not exist.
